Dimension.name: Achiever
Dimension.PrimaryGoal: To be the best and make the most of every opportunity. Being recognized as distinctive and standing out in a way that elicits a response from others.

Characteristics.Understanding: High performers seeking critical and standout roles to bring success to organizations. They often raise the bar on quality and standards through personal ambitions and achievements.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments allowing them to be key and central, with opportunities to lead and give direction. Cultures valuing high performers and rewarding exceeding expectations.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Highly collaborative environments, mundane tasks, settings with little recognition for unique contributions, or organizations not striving for excellence.
Characteristics.WatchOutFor: Tendency to dismiss others' contributions and become overly focused on personal performance, potentially leading to unrealistic standards.
Characteristics.TeamDynamics: Ambitious, goal-oriented, fostering healthy competition and inspiring others to excel.

Dimension.Voice: Strategic and assertive communicators focused on results and motivating others with ambition and high standards.
Dimension.Brand: Known for excellence and strong leadership, setting examples and inspiring others with drive and accomplishments.
Dimension.Fears: Underperformance, lack of recognition, being held back, environments not challenging their unique contributions.
Dimension.AtTheirBest: Have autonomy in decision-making, receive recognition, and experience opportunities to lead, set standards, and excel in every endeavor.
Dimension.WorkAtItsBest: Challenging roles with clear goals, leadership opportunities, and an environment acknowledging distinctive contributions and impact.
Dimension.LifeAtItsBest: Continuous personal growth, achieving significant milestones, having impactful experiences that drive satisfaction and inspire others.
Dimension.NotableExamples: Cher, Elon Musk, Beyoncé, Michael Phelps

YouKnowYoureThisTypeWhen.Item: Set a high bar and reach it.

CommunicationStrategy.FramingApproach: Frame everything around excellence and distinction
CommunicationStrategy.ProblemFraming: Position as falling short of potential, missing competitive edge
CommunicationStrategy.SolutionApproach: Show how MCode creates standout performance and recognition
CommunicationStrategy.OutcomeFocus: Being the best, exceeding industry standards, distinctive results
CommunicationStrategy.NextStepLogic: Choose products that demonstrate superiority and measurable wins
CommunicationStrategy.CommunicationStyle: Confident, results-focused, emphasizing uniqueness and achievement

Dimension.name: Driver
Dimension.PrimaryGoal: To move things forward at all costs, meet challenges head on, and overcome obstacles to press on to the finish line.

Characteristics.Understanding: Look for opportunities to advance toward established goals and motivate others. Thrive in challenging situations, staying calm under pressure and tenacious despite resistance.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Goal-oriented environments with well-defined plans. Settings with clear communication about next steps and deadlines, presenting challenging or "impossible" missions.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Positions with little room for personal advancement or too simple/mundane assignments. Ongoing work without clear completion dates.
Characteristics.WatchOutFor: Potential for discontent or boredom without advancement opportunities. Risk of burnout if stress builds up or taking on too much.
Characteristics.TeamDynamics: Prepared, resilient, confident, courageous, gritty, bold, and the voice of reason in chaos. Dedicated to achieving victory and rising above challenges.

Dimension.Voice: Direct, decisive communicators focused on progress and solutions, clearly articulating goals and steps to achieve them.
Dimension.Brand: Resilient, determined, goal-oriented leaders thriving under pressure, embracing challenges and driving meaningful results.
Dimension.Fears: Stagnation, delays beyond control, lack of challenges or advancement opportunities, absence of clear goals.
Dimension.AtTheirBest: Seek opportunities challenging resilience, allow for decisive action and progress, with autonomy to tackle significant obstacles.
Dimension.WorkAtItsBest: Goal-oriented and challenging environments, clear objectives and deadlines, recognition for persistence and determination.
Dimension.LifeAtItsBest: Overcoming challenges, achieving bold goals, engaging in pursuits testing limits and allowing continuous growth.
Dimension.NotableExamples: Leonardo DiCaprio, Indra Nooyi, Oprah Winfrey, Brett Favre

CommunicationStrategy.ProblemFraming: Identify specific barriers preventing progress toward goals
CommunicationStrategy.SolutionApproach: Present MCode as the tool to break through and drive forward
CommunicationStrategy.OutcomeFocus: Clear goal achievement, momentum, overcoming challenges
CommunicationStrategy.NextStepLogic: Choose products that deliver immediate, measurable progress
CommunicationStrategy.CommunicationStyle: Direct, action-oriented, emphasizing forward movement and results

Dimension.name: Influencer
Dimension.PrimaryGoal: To see possibilities, shape and impact the people, products, and systems around them, and persuade others to join their efforts.

Characteristics.Understanding: Desire to help others reach their potential, seeing the gold in others. Advance civilization through inspiration and practical dreaming, building and creating from nothing.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with new prospects and possibility-thinking. Cultures that bring out the best in people and value mentoring and personal growth.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Work environments where ideas are only talked about and not implemented. Settings lacking freedom to share and implement ideas.
Characteristics.WatchOutFor: Tendency to over-influence or be pushy with ideas. Risk of seeing potential in everything, leading to poor resource allocation.
Characteristics.TeamDynamics: Charismatic and inspiring, captivating others with visions and compelling ideas that engage and empower in transformative ways.

Dimension.Voice: Charismatic, passionate, infectious communicators sharing vision and engaging others with a persuasive, inspiring style.
Dimension.Brand: Ability to inspire and lead others. Often seen as visionaries, turning ideas into action and fostering growth in people and projects.
Dimension.Fears: Unimplemented ideas, environments stifling creativity or ignoring potential, failing to gain buy-in, inspire, or mobilize others.
Dimension.AtTheirBest: In spaces where ideas are embraced and implemented, leadership flourishes, and talent for inspiring others is recognized and harnessed.
Dimension.WorkAtItsBest: Dynamic environment with new possibilities, celebrating innovative thinking, focusing on mentoring, and bringing creative ideas to life.
Dimension.LifeAtItsBest: Series of transformative, enriching experiences, inspiring and connecting with others while pursuing ambitious goals and creating personal fulfillment.
Dimension.NotableExamples: Matthew McConaughey, Warren Buffett, Michelle Obama, Simone Biles

CommunicationStrategy.FramingApproach: Center on human potential and transformation
CommunicationStrategy.ProblemFraming: Unrealized potential in people, missed transformation opportunities
CommunicationStrategy.SolutionApproach: Show how MCode unlocks and inspires human greatness
CommunicationStrategy.OutcomeFocus: Transforming lives, inspiring others, creating ripple effects
CommunicationStrategy.NextStepLogic: Choose products that create inspiring transformation experiences
CommunicationStrategy.CommunicationStyle: Visionary, inspiring, emphasizing human impact and possibility

Dimension.name: Learner
Dimension.PrimaryGoal: To discover, understand, and increase knowledge. To strive to comprehend, then demonstrate, and live out newly acquired proficiencies.

Characteristics.Understanding: Driven to gain cutting-edge knowledge and discover new techniques. Push boundaries of what's known and seek expertise. Desire to share learning, fueling imaginations and inspiring others.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments requiring high degrees of knowledge or expertise, with opportunities to teach or demonstrate wisdom. Settings allowing exploration of new ideas and research-focused responsibilities.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Work environments not valuing their expertise or hunger for knowledge. Overly prescriptive, simple, or shallow work with little time for research.
Characteristics.WatchOutFor: Need for time and space to gain information. May struggle with forced collaboration beyond teaching or modeling known information.
Characteristics.TeamDynamics: Curious, inquisitive, observant, and perceptive to new insights. Thoughtful, analytical, and reflective, often providing innovative ideas or knowing where to find answers.

Dimension.Voice: Analytical, reflective communicators who simplify complex concepts and share insights and knowledge in a thoughtful, inquisitive way.
Dimension.Brand: Deep curiosity, expertise, and commitment to continuous learning. Respected, knowledgeable, and innovative thinkers.
Dimension.Fears: Stalled personal growth, sticking with the status quo, environments undervaluing expertise, inability to explore or share new knowledge.
Dimension.AtTheirBest: Constantly evolving and excelling, with autonomy to explore new fields, access to resources for deepening knowledge, and platforms to share findings.
Dimension.WorkAtItsBest: Environment valuing expertise and continuous learning, providing opportunities for research, discovery, and teaching, allowing extensive knowledge growth and sharing.
Dimension.LifeAtItsBest: Ongoing journey of discovery, filled with intellectual growth, sharing insights, and inspiring others, leading to deep personal and professional fulfillment.
Dimension.NotableExamples: Johnny Depp, Madame Curie, Albert Einstein, Serena Williams

YouKnowYoureThisTypeWhen.Item: Teach the world what you know.

CommunicationStrategy.FramingApproach: Build around knowledge, understanding, and expertise
CommunicationStrategy.ProblemFraming: Lack of deep understanding, superficial insights, knowledge gaps
CommunicationStrategy.SolutionApproach: Present MCode's scientific depth and learning opportunities
CommunicationStrategy.NextStepLogic: Choose products that provide learning and knowledge expansion
CommunicationStrategy.CommunicationStyle: Educational, detailed, emphasizing research and methodology

Dimension.name: Optimizer
Dimension.PrimaryGoal: To establish new and enhance existing systems, operations, and efficiencies through improving, fine-tuning, fixing, organizing, and solving problems.

Characteristics.Understanding: Precise and reliable, often setting standards for social justice and change. Attentive to details others miss, seeking to improve and bring desired results to problematic situations.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments providing detailed expectations and requirements, where fine-tuning and attention-to-detail skills are primary. Organizations looking to improve, repair, or revamp services and products.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Organizations where products and processes are not established or require significant blank-slate work. Settings without defined expectations or clear direction from management.
Characteristics.WatchOutFor: Tendency to be overly strict or critical with rules or standards. Risk of creating problems where none exist due to the need to fix something.
Characteristics.TeamDynamics: Analytical and often in problem-solving mode. Continuously bringing improvement and efficiency to every area they touch.

Dimension.Voice: Precise, detail-oriented communicators focusing on practical solutions, improvements, and articulating exact requirements and standards.
Dimension.Brand: Detail-oriented, meticulous, and reliable. Efficient problem-solvers who improve and fine-tune systems and processes.
Dimension.Fears: Unclear expectations, disorganized environments, improvisation, and situations where their skills are underutilized or unappreciated.
Dimension.AtTheirBest: In roles valuing their meticulous approach, with clear guidelines, opportunities to refine systems, and ensuring contributions lead to tangible improvements.
Dimension.WorkAtItsBest: Well-defined expectations, focus on enhancing systems and processes, opportunities to use precision and attention to detail for organizational improvement.
Dimension.LifeAtItsBest: Filled with opportunities to apply problem-solving skills, make things work better, and enhance personal and professional environments for accomplishment and satisfaction.
Dimension.NotableExamples: Duane Johnson, James Dyson, Marie Kondo, Lindsey Vonn

CommunicationStrategy.FramingApproach: Focus on improvement and systematic enhancement
CommunicationStrategy.SolutionApproach: Show how MCode systematically improves existing systems
CommunicationStrategy.OutcomeFocus: Better efficiency, enhanced performance, refined processes
CommunicationStrategy.NextStepLogic: Choose products that optimize current operations
CommunicationStrategy.CommunicationStyle: Practical, systematic, emphasizing improvement and refinement

Dimension.name: Orchestrator
Dimension.PrimaryGoal: To bring definition, direction, and oversight to people, processes, and efforts. To lead and be key in developing strategies and implementing them.

Characteristics.Understanding: Bring separate or disconnected things together, establishing practical steps others missed and directing people to accomplish tasks in organized ways. Leave impactful legacies and provide assurance in uncertainty.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments allowing organization and oversight of people and processes. Settings where they can establish practical strategies and have their expertise valued.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Work environments confined to improving existing systems. Cultures with ambiguous roles or lacking leadership opportunities. Settings allowing projects to remain unfinished.
Characteristics.WatchOutFor: Desire for involvement in every project stage, potentially overextending their role. Need to balance personal responsibility and stress levels.
Characteristics.TeamDynamics: Strategic leaders who bring order and direction. Skilled at coordinating diverse elements and people to achieve unified goals.

Dimension.Voice: Decisive, strategic, clear communicators aiming to create order through articulation of practical steps for achieving goals.
Dimension.Brand: Leaders with strategic planning skills and ability to unify teams and processes. Lay strong foundations and drive outcomes.
Dimension.Fears: Lack of control over outcomes, unfinished projects, environments that don't value strategic leadership, being excluded from important decisions.
Dimension.AtTheirBest: Leading and making impactful decisions in environments valuing their planning and organizational skills, with autonomy to unite people and processes for common goals.
Dimension.WorkAtItsBest: Strategic environments requiring oversight and coordination, with opportunities to establish systems and lead initiatives from conception to completion.
Dimension.LifeAtItsBest: Building lasting legacies through strategic leadership, creating order from chaos, and seeing long-term visions come to fruition.
Dimension.NotableExamples: Steve Jobs, Condoleezza Rice, Jeff Bezos, Vince Lombardi

YouKnowYoureThisTypeWhen.Item: Organize and bring order to chaos.

CommunicationStrategy.FramingApproach: Present as strategic framework for organizational leadership
CommunicationStrategy.ProblemFraming: Lack of coordination, unclear structure, leadership challenges
CommunicationStrategy.SolutionApproach: Position MCode as comprehensive organizational framework
CommunicationStrategy.OutcomeFocus: Strategic alignment, coordinated teams, effective leadership
CommunicationStrategy.NextStepLogic: Choose products that provide systematic team organization
CommunicationStrategy.CommunicationStyle: Strategic, comprehensive, emphasizing leadership and coordination

Dimension.name: Relator
Dimension.PrimaryGoal: To inspire and connect with others, make meaningful contributions to a team, and truly believe more can be accomplished together than alone.

Characteristics.Understanding: Bring people together, clarify group vision/mission, elevate team connection and collaboration. Encourage and model values, demonstrate humility, inspire others through selfless contributions.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Work environments demonstrating care for employees and customers through service-based culture. Settings where team contributions make a real difference and high performance standards align with greater good.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Primarily independent roles. Environments where high standards and outstanding achievements are not defined or communicated. Work not promoting meeting others' needs or accomplishing tasks for greater good.
Characteristics.WatchOutFor: Need to maintain healthy boundaries and practice self-care to avoid losing individual identity within team.
Characteristics.TeamDynamics: Heart and soul of teams, fostering connection and collaboration. Empathetic leaders who prioritize collective success over individual achievement.

Dimension.Voice: Empathetic, sincere, collaborative communicators who listen attentively and articulate the collective vision and needs of a group or team.
Dimension.Brand: Service-oriented with genuine concern for others. Ability to inspire and unite teams makes them the heart and soul of any group.
Dimension.Fears: Isolation, selfish environments, lack of meaningful team connection, being unable to serve others or make a difference.
Dimension.AtTheirBest: In environments fostering strong teamwork, recognizing their empathetic nature and connection abilities, allowing meaningful contributions to team success.
Dimension.WorkAtItsBest: Collaborative environments focused on service and team achievement, with clear shared values and opportunities to support others' growth and success.
Dimension.LifeAtItsBest: Rich with meaningful relationships and opportunities to serve others, creating positive impact through connection and collaboration.
Dimension.NotableExamples: Oprah Winfrey, Mr. Rogers, Mother Teresa, John Wooden

YouKnowYoureThisTypeWhen.Item: Serve others and put them first.
Believe teamwork makes the dream work.
Seek opportunities to make a difference.
Listen to understand and show empathy.

CommunicationStrategy.FramingApproach: Frame around relationships and collective success
CommunicationStrategy.ProblemFraming: Disconnected teams, relationship challenges, lack of collaboration
CommunicationStrategy.SolutionApproach: Show how MCode strengthens connections and team unity
CommunicationStrategy.OutcomeFocus: Stronger relationships, team harmony, collective achievement
CommunicationStrategy.NextStepLogic: Choose products that bring teams together and build connections

Dimension.name: Visionary
Dimension.PrimaryGoal: To envision possibilities, ideas, and opportunities, and make them happen with design and creative strategies. To inspire and bring to life what others dream about.

Characteristics.Understanding: Creative and innovative thinkers bringing traction and progress to others' ideas and dreams. Drive social change, enrich life, model high morals and values. See possibilities in ideas and people others might overlook.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Work environments where ideas and dreams can be expressed creatively and become reality. Atmospheres embracing potential, possibilities, and ambition, allowing execution, innovation, and realization of visions.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments lacking freedom for originality, creation, or incorporation of personal mission and values. Settings discouraging innovative, out-of-the-box thinking or lacking ongoing training/mentoring.
Characteristics.WatchOutFor: Tendency to consider their ideas as best, struggling with critique. Need to stay grounded in reality, avoid distraction by endless possibilities, and focus on completing work.
Characteristics.TeamDynamics: Inspirational leaders who cast compelling visions and motivate others to pursue ambitious goals. Bridge the gap between dreams and reality.

Dimension.Voice: Creative, imaginative, innovative, inspirational communicators who can articulate future possibilities and transformative visions.
Dimension.Brand: Defined by creativity, originality, and ability to see and realize potential in ideas and people. Pioneers and change-makers.
Dimension.Fears: Stifled creativity, conventional thinking, inability to realize visions, environments that suppress innovation and original ideas.
Dimension.AtTheirBest: In spaces nurturing creative thinking, supporting ambitious goals, valuing unique perspectives, and enabling transformative ideas to come to life.
Dimension.WorkAtItsBest: Creative environments encouraging innovation and original thinking, with freedom to pursue ambitious visions and transform ideas into reality.
Dimension.LifeAtItsBest: Continuous creative expression and innovation, bringing transformative visions to life while inspiring others to reach for extraordinary possibilities.
Dimension.NotableExamples: Walt Disney, Steve Jobs, Frida Kahlo, Martin Luther King Jr.

YouKnowYoureThisTypeWhen.Item: Cast a vision for the future.
Live out your morals and values.

CommunicationStrategy.FramingApproach: Present as creative breakthrough for future possibilities
CommunicationStrategy.ProblemFraming: Stuck in current reality, limited thinking, innovation barriers
CommunicationStrategy.SolutionApproach: Position MCode as catalyst for innovative transformation
CommunicationStrategy.OutcomeFocus: Creative breakthroughs, future possibilities, innovative solutions
CommunicationStrategy.NextStepLogic: Choose products that enable creative exploration and innovation
CommunicationStrategy.CommunicationStyle: Imaginative, future-focused, emphasizing creativity and possibility
